page.title: 05FARMING - A DETAILED LOOK
page.content: CANK FARM HAS A HISTORY OF EXPERIMENTS TO IMPROVE EFFICIENCY. EVEN WHEN IT WAS A DAIRY FARM THERE WERE REGULAR INNOVATIONS TO IMPROVE MILK YIELD. ONE METHOD WAS THAT OF THE PADDOCK - FIELDS WERE SPLIT INTO 4 PADDOCKS AND COWS WERE GRAZED ON DIFFERENT SECTIONS EACH DAY SO THAT PASTURE WAS FRESH. THE ALTERNATIVE STRIP METHOD MOVED THE GRAZING AREA DAILY IN A 6 FEET STRIP - ELECTRICALLY FENCED - FOR FRESH GRASS. CROPS NOW GROWN ARE MAINLY CEREALS LIKE WHEAT, BARLEY AND RYE. THIS FARM HAS NEVER GROWN SUGAR BEET AS A BREAK CROP BUT USES THE MORE POPULAR RAPE FOR THIS PURPOSE, IN COMMON WITH MANY OTHER LOCAL FARMERS. MOST FARM JOBS ARE NOW DONE BY CONTRACTORS - SO THAT PLOUGHING, SPRAYING, DRILLING,HEDGING AND COMBINING ARE DONE BY SPECIALISTS. CORN IS CARTED WITH TRACTORS AND TRAILERS BY THE FAMILY.
